main event: Multiple sightings of a fast-moving, large, oblong object with bright orange glow were reported in Indiana on November 15, 1957. The object was observed by an Air Force radar operator and multiple civilians, traveling at a rapid rate of speed and making abrupt maneuvers before disappearing completely.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be 200-300 ft in diameter and traveled across the sky for approximately 3-4 minutes
Witnesses described the object as white or silver in color, oblong in shape, and illuminated with a bright orange glow around the edges
The object did not make any sound and disappeared after a minute or so
It was compared to being 10 to 15 times longer than a full-size jet, and its size was estimated to be 50 or more times the size of a basketball
Multiple witnesses reported seeing the same object, including an 18-year-old boy and other residents in the area
sighted object: large, oblong object with a bright orange glow
